#Text=Theodosius of Sinai
#Text=Theodosius of Sinai ( Bulgarian : Теодосий Синаитски ) , ( Macedonian : Теодосиј Синаитски ) , was a Bulgarian priest , writer and printer . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=He founded the first Bulgarian printing-house in Thessaloniki . [ 4 ]
#Text=Theodosius of Sinai is considered an ethnic Macedonian in North Macedonia .
#Text=Teodosy 's introduction to " Solace of the sinner "

column1: #Text=Teodosius was born in the late 18th century in the town of Dojran , Ottoman Empire ( today in North Macedonia ) .
#Text=His birth name was Teohar ( Bulgarian : Теохар ) .
#Text=After he had finished Greek language school in Istanbul , Teohar went back to Dojran , where he got married and was later ordained a priest .
#Text=The death of his wife however drove him into a pilgrimage to the Holy Land .
#Text=In 1828 Teohar became a monk in Saint Catherine 's Monastery and there he adopted the monastic name Teodosiues ( Theodosiy in Bulgarian ) .
#Text=After returning to the Balkans , Theodosius was appointed a priest in " St. Minas " church in Solun ( Thessaloniki ) in 1831 .
#Text=While in Solun , he established the firsts printing house in Bulgarian language in 1838 .
#Text=Theodosius used the movable type printing press of Daskal Kamche from Vatasha .
#Text=The moveable types of the press were crafted by a Russian immigrant type-founder .

#Text=The first books , typed in Teodosius 's printing house , were " Primary study through Slavonic-Bulgarian and Greek Orthodox morning prayers " ( „ Началное учение с молитви утренния славяноболгарский и греческия “ ) and " Jewish ceremony and all of the harms , they 've done " - an anti-Semitic lampoon , which was initially translated " to simple and plain Bulgarian language " by Nathanael Ohridski .

column1: #Text=" Jewish ceremony. . "
#Text=In 1839 Teodosius ' printing-house was burned down , but it was soon restored with the finansical support of Kiril Peychinovich .
#Text=Peychinovich 's book Utesheniе Greshnim ( " Solace of the sinner " ) was typed in the restored printing-house in 1840 .

#Text=Teodosius wrote an introduction to the book , where he mentioned that the book was written by Kiril Peychinovich into " ... the plainest Bulgarian language , spoken in Lower Moesia , and the region of Skopje and Tetovo ... " .
#Text=There Teodosius also praised the Bulgarian language and compared it to a key , which can unlock the heart of the Bulgarian nation for the light of the truth .
#Text=In 1841 Teodosius typed a book , called " A book for studying three languages - Slavonic-Bulgarian , Greek and Karamanlian " .
#Text=The book was a Bulgarian-Greek- Turkish dictionary , designed to be of use for merchants .
#Text=In 1843 a fire destroyed Teodosius 's printing house for a second and final time .
#Text=Theodosius returned to Dojran , where he began working as a miller in his sons ' water-mill .
#Text=According to Arseniy Kostentsev , the usable remains of Theodosius ' printing press were taken to the village of Vataša . [ 5 ]
#Text=Theodosius died in an accident in March 1843 .
#Text=He was killed by a collapsed roof .
#Text=Nine years after Theodosius ' death , the brothers Kiryak and Konstantin Darzhilovi opened a new Bulgarian language printing press in Thessaloniki .
